DataElement.preferredName: Health Care Provider Instruction Six Mercaptopurine Do Not Take With Milk Dairy Product Or Citrus Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to indicate if there was an instruction by a health care provider to not take 6MP with milk, dairy products or citrus.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Care Provider Instruction Six Mercaptopurine Do Not Take With Milk Dairy Product Or Citrus
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)_A message describing how something is to be done._Perform or execute._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A body substance containing proteins, fats, lactose, and various vitamins and minerals produced by the mammary glands of mature female bovines._Food made from the milk of some mammals, most commonly cows, goats and sheep._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A characteristic of a medicinal product, specifying that its most predominant agreeable savor detected by the unified sensation of taste and olfactory receptors resembles citrus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Property.preferredName: Six Mercaptopurine Do Negation Take With Cow Milk Dairy Product Or Citrus Flavor Instruction
Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.:A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04):Perform or execute.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A body substance containing proteins, fats, lactose, and various vitamins and minerals produced by the mammary glands of mature female bovines.:Raw and processed or manufactured milk and milk-derived products. These are usually from cows (bovine) but are also from goats, sheep, reindeer, and water buffalo.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A characteristic of a medicinal product, specifying that its most predominant agreeable savor detected by the unified sensation of taste and olfactory receptors resembles citrus.:A message describing how something is to be done.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A body substance containing proteins, fats, lactose, and various vitamins and minerals produced by the mammary glands of mature female bovines.
Food made from the milk of some mammals, most commonly cows, goats and sheep.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A characteristic of a medicinal product, specifying that its most predominant agreeable savor detected by the unified sensation of taste and olfactory receptors resembles citrus.
A message describing how something is to be done.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
